fields.name: Aim of Study
fields.description: State the main purpose or objective of the study as described by the authors
fields.value: To compare the environmental impact of post-MI follow-up as care on site (CoS) alone and follow-up that included telemonitoring; and to explore how telemonitoring’s environmental impact influences patients’ and HPs’ perceptions of its use in follow-up post-MI and post-catheter ablation (CA).
fields.evidence_quote: Given these gaps in the literature, the aim of this study was twofold: to compare the environmental impact of post-MI follow-up as care on site (CoS) alone and follow-up that included telemonitoring; and to explore how telemonitoring’s environmental impact influences patients’ and HPs’ perceptions of its use in follow-up post-MI and post-catheter ablation (CA).

fields.name: Key Findings
fields.description: Summarize the main results or conclusions of the study
fields.value: Telemonitoring had a substantially bigger environmental impact than CoS in the studied setting. Patient commute distance, reuse of devices, and tailored use of devices should be considered when implementing telemonitoring for clinical follow-up. Patients and HPs supported these solutions to enhance sustainability-informed cardiovascular care as the default option.
fields.evidence_quote: Telemonitoring had a substantially bigger environmental impact than CoS in the studied setting. Patient commute distance, reuse of devices, and tailored use of devices should be considered when implementing telemonitoring for clinical follow-up. Patients and HPs supported these solutions to enhance sustainability-informed cardiovascular care as the default option.
